children.subject:
There isn't an explicit requirement on the hours; however, we do expect our collaborator to be actively involved (which means making weekly meetings, hitting the milestones, etc.) and be able to finish the project by the end of summer.

We will likely recruit in the fall as well, but the projects may be different.

In short, we want our collaborator to be as excited about the project as we are. :)
How many hours per week are these roles meant to be? Also, would they continue into the fall?

Hey Shaokai! Thanks for sharing this amazing opportunity :)

As the one interested in this project, I want to ask you if there are any preferred requirements regarding programming languages or frameworks which would be used for this project. As the one who just finished my freshman year at Cal two weeks ago, I have a bit of experience with java and python but am worried about my lack of explicit experience with other languages or specific frameworks. 

Thanks!

history.content:
Hi everyone,

Are you interested in building reliable cyber-physical systems? 😃

The Lingua Franca (LF) project is looking for summer collaborators to work on a few exciting research projects, including the LF compiler, Autoware, bare-metal platforms, and more.

Project details and the application portal can be found here: https://forms.gle/mZorFexuUcgDSJaV6

If you have any questions, please contact Shaokai (shaokai@berkeley.edu).

Thanks for your attention.
history.subject: Summer Research Opportunities
